chapter.title: Share IP address between servers
chapter.para:
The following flow chart shows the steps for sharing an IP address between two newly created servers or two existing servers with the same publicIPZoneId. Detailed steps are provided in this section.
For servers to share aÂ public IP address, the servers must be in the same publicIPZoneId. To determine whether the servers are in the same publicIPZoneId, use the Get /servers/{serverID} API operation to get the server details and view the contents of the RAX-PUBLIC-IP-ZONE-ID:publicIPZoneId attribute. If the shared IP address is a Cloud Networks (or Isolated network) address, then servers do not have to be in the same publicIPZoneId.
The user needs to configure a heartbeat mechanism between using an application, such as VRRP, keepalived, and so on, to control ownership of the Shared IP.
